title: qt3 and qt4/q5 causing unsatisfiable version constraint
body:
Summary:

We have a stable but older (qt3) GUI in openspeedshop that gets built by openspeedshop by default.
We have a new qt4/qt5 based GUI built by the cbtf-argonavis-gui package which depends on some of the libraries and components in openspeedshop.    When I try to build cbtf-argonavis-gui, I get this error:
```
cbtf-argonavis-gui requires qt version 5.10.0, but spec asked for 3.3.8b
```

I've tried a number of things to avoid the qt3 versus qt5 conflict, such as adding a gui variant:
```
    variant('gui', default='qt3', values=('none', 'qt3', 'qt4'),
            description='Build or not build a GUI of choice'
    )
```
and then building openspeedshop twice, once with the qt3 variant and once with the qt4 variant, but then I have two versions of openspeedshop which is confusing to users because one version is complete and one version doesn't have the qt3 GUI.

I can build the complete openspeedshop package and then point the cbtf-argonavis-gui build to that version of openspeedshop outside of spack without issues, but spack is complaining about qt3 and qt4/qt5 requirements.   Seems like only one version can be active for some reason.

Is there a solution in spack for this type of usage?

Thanks
Jim G
